item.title: Branch-and-Browse: Efficient and Controllable Web Exploration with Tree-Structured Reasoning and Action Memory
item.description: arXiv:2510.19838v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Autonomous web agents powered by large language models (LLMs) show strong potential for performing goal-oriented tasks such as information retrieval, report generation, and online transactions. item.title: AI PB: A Grounded Generative Agent for Personalized Investment Insights
item.description: arXiv:2510.20099v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present AI PB, a production-scale generative agent deployed in real retail finance. Unlike reactive chatbots that answer queries passively, AI PB proactively generates grounded, compliant, and user-specific investment insights. It integrates (i) a ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, context, product, LLM, embedding | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: From Large to Small: Transferring CUDA Optimization Expertise via Reasoning Graph
item.description: arXiv:2510.19873v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Despite significant evolution of CUDA programming and domain-specific libraries, effectively utilizing GPUs with massively parallel engines remains difficult. Large language models (LLMs) show strong potential in generating optimized CUDA code from se...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, RAG, API, augmented, reasoning | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Contextual Augmentation for Entity Linking using Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2510.18888v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Entity Linking involves detecting and linking entity mentions in natural language texts to a knowledge graph. Traditional methods use a two-step process with separate models for entity recognition and disambiguation, which can be computationally inten...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, context, RAG, framework, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> RAG, reasoning, knowledge base, vector, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Are Greedy Task Orderings Better Than Random in Continual Linear Regression?
item.description: arXiv:2510.19941v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We analyze task orderings in continual learning for linear regression, assuming joint realizability of training data. We focus on orderings that greedily maximize dissimilarity between consecutive tasks, a concept briefly explored in prior work but st...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, tool, RAG | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 60%</small>
